title: About
text:
Welcome to my website! I’m Dom, a passionate researcher with a keen interest in mdedical data and statistical methodologies. This blog is my space to explore concepts and share insights about the fascinating world of data science.

My journey
My path to data science has been anything but straightforward. I began my career as a physical therapist, driven by a passion for helping people recover from injuries. While pursuing my Master’s degree in physical therapy, I took biostatistics and statistical programming courses. Then, I discovered the potential of statistics in health sciences to improve patient outcomes.
Fascinated by the opportunities of statistics and machine learning, I needed to solidify my foundation in programming, mathematics, and statistics, which drove me to pursue a further degree in Computational Life Science. Today, I work as a research associate, using my expertise to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions in computational health. In addition to research, I assist in teaching courses in machine learning, signal processing, and informatics at the undergraduate level.


What you’ll find here
On this blog, you’ll find a mix of:

In-depth Articles: The articles will cover the core statistical concepts: Descriptive and inferential statistics, predictive modeling, and exploratory data analysis. I am keen on working hands-on with Python and will provide code examples to illustrate concepts.
Case Studies: Real-world examples of statistical analysis. With my former background in health sciences, the main focus will be on medical data.
Stats by Hand: A series of articles where I will implement statistical concepts from scratch. This will help me and others to understand the underlying mathematics and logic behind statistical methods.



Why this Blog
I started with this blog to provide others with insights into data science and deepen my understanding of statistical methodologies. Early on, I realized the importance of fundamental statistical concepts to adequately understand and interpret data. Through my studies, I found that I need to research and document a topic concisely and precisely to learn effectively. It is when I can explain a concept well enough for others to grasp that I fully understand it myself. This process often involves simplifying complex concepts into well-understandable terms.
Please note that the content of this blog reflects my personal opinions and does not represent the views of my employer(s).

title: The Science of Data
text:
The Science of Data


Welcome to The Science of Data, a blog about statistical analysis in Python. The goal of this blog is to deepen my understanding of statistical methodologies and share these insights with fellow data enthusiasts.
Along with explaining and illustrating statistical concepts, some of the content will also include case studies, primarily from the medical field.
Stick around and I hope you enjoy the content!

title: About
text:
Welcome to my blog! I’m Dom, a passionate data enthusiast with a keen interest in statistical methodologies. This blog is my space to explore, learn, and share insights about the fascinating world of data science.


My journey into data science is quite unique. I started as a physical therapist, where I developed a deep understanding of the human body and patient care. During my Master’s degree in physiotherapy, I became increasingly interested in the quantitative aspects of health. This curiosity led me to pursue a second degree in computational life science, where I focused on the application of statistical modeling and statistics in the field of computational health. Currently, I work as a research associate, where I apply my expertise to develop innovative solutions in health sciences.



As a researcher with a keen interest in data analytics and machine learning, I am driven by the impact these fields have on health sciences. My goal is to use my clinical and scientific expertise to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions that can transform patient care and advance medical research.



On this blog, you’ll find a mix of: - In-depth Articles: Detailed explorations of statistical methods and their applications in data science. - Tutorials: Step-by-step guides to help you implement statistical techniques in your own projects. - Discussions: Thought-provoking posts aimed at sparking conversations and debates among fellow data enthusiasts. - Learning Resources: Recommendations for books, courses, and other materials that have helped me along the way.



I started with this blog to provide others with insights into data science and thereby deepen my understanding of statistical methodologies. Early on, I realized the importance of fundamental statistical concepts to adequately understand and interpret data. I found that to learn effectively, I need to adequately research a topic and document it concisely and precisely. Writing for an audience also challenges me to simplify complex ideas, and if I can explain a concept well enough for others to grasp it, then I know I’ve fully understood it myself.

title: About
text:
My path to data science has been anything but straightforward. I began my career as a physical therapist, driven by a passion for helping people recover from injuries and enhance their quality of life. This role allowed me to deeply understand human anatomy, pathologies, and patient care. While pursuing my Master’s degree in physiotherapy, I took courses in biostatistics and statistical programming. It was then that I discovered the potential of statistics in health sciences to improve patient outcomes.
My growing interest in the quantitative side of health led me to pursue a second Master’s degree in computational life science, where I specialized in machine learning and the statistical analysis of medical data. Today, I work as a research associate, using my expertise to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions in computational health.

title: About
text:
As a researcher with a keen interest in data analytics and machine learning, I am driven by the impact these fields have on health sciences. My goal is to use my clinical and scientific expertise to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions that can transform patient care and advance medical research.


On this blog, you’ll find a mix of:
- In-depth Articles: Detailed explorations of statistical methods and their applications in data science. - Tutorials: Step-by-step guides to help you implement statistical techniques in your own projects. - Discussions: Thought-provoking posts aimed at sparking conversations and debates among fellow data enthusiasts. - Learning Resources: Recommendations for books, courses, and other materials that have helped me along the way.



I started with this blog to provide others with insights into data science and thereby deepen my understanding of statistical methodologies. Early on, I realized the importance of fundamental statistical concepts to adequately understand and interpret data. I found that to learn effectively, I need to adequately research a topic and document it concisely and precisely. Writing for an audience also challenges me to simplify complex ideas, and if I can explain a concept well enough for others to grasp it, then I know I’ve fully understood it myself.
